meanings.definition: The act of relegating someone or something to a lower rank or position.
meanings.sent1: After the team's poor performance, the coach made several relegations to the bench.
meanings.sent2: The relegations of certain employees led to a more efficient work environment.
meanings.sent3: The relegations of the old toys to the attic made room for new ones in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: Her relegations of outdated ideas allowed for fresh perspectives to emerge.
meanings.sent5: The relegations of the old furniture to the garage created a cozy space in the living room.

meanings.definition: The process of transferring a sports team to a lower division.
meanings.sent1: The relegations of the soccer team disappointed their loyal fans.
meanings.sent2: The relegations of the baseball team affected their chances of winning.
meanings.sent3: The relegations of the chess club to the beginner's league sparked new interest in the game.
meanings.sent4: The relegations of the swim team to a lower division motivated them to train harder.
meanings.sent5: The relegations of the basketball team to a lower league surprised many sports enthusiasts.

meanings.definition: The act of assigning someone or something to a less important role or status.
meanings.sent1: Her relegations of tasks to the intern helped lighten her workload.
meanings.sent2: The relegations of responsibilities to the new employee boosted his confidence.
meanings.sent3: The relegations of dessert duty to the kids brought joy to the family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: His relegations of minor decisions to his assistant allowed him to focus on major issues.
meanings.sent5: The relegations of cleaning chores to the robot vacuum saved time for the homeowners.
